snippet: Much of the growth of federal higher-education spending has been increases in veterans’ education benefits and Pell grants.
abstract: Pew Charitable Trusts report finds that federal government has outpaced states in providing funding for higher education for first time in recent years; cites federal funding of $75.6 billion in 2013, compared to $72.7 billion in state funding.
lead_paragraph: Much of the growth of federal higher-education spending has been increases in veterans’ education benefits and Pell grants.

headline.main: Federal Money for Education Surpasses States’ Contributions
headline.print_headline: Federal Money for Higher Education Surpasses States’ Contributions
